data.title: Use selection priority in double-click selection logic. Fixes #4053.
SyncInfo is only valid during the initial lobby phase. Fixes #3973.
data.body: Existing broken replays can be fixed manually by removing the SyncInfo order at the end of the file.

data.title: Remove "Humans vs Bots" auto-team if bots are disabled. Fixes #4074.
Load the main mod dlls for all mods. Fixes #4029.
Fix viceroids and add contrails to C&C rockets.
Fix a NRE in the exception handler.
data.body: The exception handler would die if an error occurred before modData was initialized.

data.title: Use the original flame and chem muzzle flashes.
data.body: Followup to #4081.

data.title: Consolidated Windows installer options
data.body: as discussed in #4052.

data.title: Equals() implementations should be made safer
data.body:
Our Equals methods make assumptions about the types of objects they are working with, and crash the game if the types are not equal. This behaviour confuses dictionaries (particularly Luainterface's object cache - we need this fixed if we want unbuggy Lua support) which can make use of Equals when doing lookups.
Here's a sample stack trace of what you could expect when trying to call a method while working with WRanges from Lua. This was pretty awful to debug, with the stack trace talking about something completely different. A simple `!(obj is WVec)` check in WVec.Equals() will fix this particular crash, but I expect there to be a few more crashes like this if it decides to check equality with other things. Edit: yup, there are

```
Exception of type `LuaInterface.LuaScriptException`: Specified cast is not valid.
Inner Exception of type `System.InvalidCastException`: Specified cast is not valid.
     at OpenRA.WVec.Equals(Object obj) in c:\Users\Scott\Code\OpenRA\OpenRA.FileFormats\WVec.cs:line 89
   at System.Collections.Generic.ObjectEqualityComparer`1.Equals(T x, T y)
   at System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary`2.FindEntry(TKey key)
   at System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary`2.TryGetValue(TKey key, TValue& value)
   at LuaInterface.ObjectTranslator.pushObject(IntPtr luaState, Object o, String metatable) in c:\Users\Scott\Code\OpenRA\LuaInterface\ObjectTranslator.cs:line 511
   at LuaInterface.ObjectTranslator.push(IntPtr luaState, Object o) in c:\Users\Scott\Code\OpenRA\LuaInterface\ObjectTranslator.cs:line 884
   at LuaInterface.LuaMethodWrapper.call(IntPtr luaState) in c:\Users\Scott\Code\OpenRA\LuaInterface\MethodWrapper.cs:line 329
   at LuaInterface.Lua.ThrowExceptionFromError(Int32 oldTop) in c:\Users\Scott\Code\OpenRA\LuaInterface\Lua.cs:line 122
   at LuaInterface.Lua.callFunction(Object function, Object[] args, Type[] returnTypes) in c:\Users\Scott\Code\OpenRA\LuaInterface\Lua.cs:line 554
   at LuaInterface.LuaFunction.call(Object[] args, Type[] returnTypes) in c:\Users\Scott\Code\OpenRA\LuaInterface\LuaFunction.cs:line 66
   at LuaInterface.LuaDelegate.callFunction(Object[] args, Object[] inArgs, Int32[] outArgs) in c:\Users\Scott\Code\OpenRA\LuaInterface\MethodWrapper.cs:line 532
```

data.title: Add an ingame chatroom TOPIC
data.body:
I think it could be good idea to add a TOPIC for the ingame chatroom.

This way, players would know good links (a link of the facebook page, to help promote the project) and news (if a new version is out - release or playtest).

data.title: Fix PerCell damage calculation.
data.body: #3861 missed an invalid use of FindActorsInBox(t, t), which broke the nuke and ion cannon.

data.title: Include specific modding-related changes in CHANGELOG.
data.body:
We should start tracking changes that specifically impact mods / custom maps in the changelog. They can go in a "Core" section along with the engine changes.

Two recent examples of changes that should be included are "Renamed LegacyCapture trait to Capture" and "Added SquadSize parameter to AirstrikePower".

data.title: Add an ingame error dialog
data.body:
If we encounter an error that doesn't fatally affect the rendering state we should pause the world (and also disable any other interactive UI) and show an ingame error dialog instead of crashing.

This could easily cover:
- Desyncs #2850.
- Network glitches (e.g. #4083, #4465).
- Exceptions thrown during tick (e.g. #4032, #3364, lua script errors).

With a bit of work it could cover exceptions during map loading by first dropping back to the shellmap.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/1066708-add-an-ingame-error-dialog?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: System.Net.Sockets.SocketException: An established connection was aborted by the software in your host machine
data.body:
**Was doing:** Just got attacked by some enemy vehicles and was engaged in a fight with them using my infantry. It was very early game. Other things I have done is to `Alt`+`Tab` frequently while waiting for the ore harvesting cycle.

```
Exception of type `System.IO.IOException`: Unable to write data to the transport connection: An established connection was aborted by the software in your host machine.
Inner Exception of type `System.Net.Sockets.SocketException`: An established connection was aborted by the software in your host machine
     at System.Net.Sockets.Socket.Send(Byte[] buffer, Int32 offset, Int32 size, SocketFlags socketFlags)
   at System.Net.Sockets.NetworkStream.Write(Byte[] buffer, Int32 offset, Int32 size)
   at System.Net.Sockets.NetworkStream.Write(Byte[] buffer, Int32 offset, Int32 size)
   at System.IO.MemoryStream.WriteTo(Stream stream)
   at OpenRA.Network.NetworkConnection.Send(Byte[] packet)
   at OpenRA.Network.EchoConnection.Send(Int32 frame, List`1 orders)
   at OpenRA.Network.ReplayRecorderConnection.Send(Int32 frame, List`1 orders)
   at OpenRA.Network.OrderManager.Tick()
   at OpenRA.Game.Tick(OrderManager orderManager)
   at OpenRA.Game.Tick(OrderManager orderManager, Viewport viewPort)
   at OpenRA.Game.Run()
   at OpenRA.Program.Run(String[] args)
   at OpenRA.Program.Main(String[] args)
```

data.title: Removed some duplicates in ./mods/cnc/bits
data.body: and got rid of a .mix file without file-names.

data.title: More customizability for some Widgets
data.body: This makes the ButtonWidget, TimerWidget, DropDownButtonWidget and CheckboxWidget more customizable in terms of text color, disabled text color, contrast, contrast color and font type.

data.title: Use more data encoded in DATA.R8
data.body: This changes nothing, but it explains more variables from http://d2kplus.com/wiki/index.php?title=Resource_Files and situations where they occur which can be used for information gathering like for #4034.

data.title: If `AllowBots: False` is set in map.yaml, lobby still shows Humans vs Bots in `Slot Admin`
TargetTypes: Individually
data.body:
The Dog-Barrel-Problem brings me on the following idea:

It would be nice if you can define individually units to TargetTypes
for example:

```
    TargetableBuilding:
        TargetTypes: Ant, Zombie
```

data.title: sequence `rotor` BUG
data.body:
If I define 2 rotors with 

```
WithRotor@PRIMARY:
    Id: rotor_1_bababa
WithRotor@SECONDARY:
    Id: rotor_2
```

And define rotor_1_bababa and rotor_2 in sequences I get the following request
Exception of type `System.InvalidOperationException`: Unit `hologramtower` does not have a sequence `rotor`

So the WithRotor@PRIMARY: alwas is "rotor"

data.title: Upgrade buildings / Tiberian Sun
data.body:
In Tiberian Sun you can upgrade buildings like the power plants. 

I thing it is necessary to implement the upgrade-feature to OpenRA (also to other mods)

data.title: Amount of Prerequisites
data.body:
I very like that you can not only define positive prerequisites but oleo negative with *Name. It would be great if you can also define an amount of buildings you need.

For example:
Prerequisites: anypower, dome, dome  or
Prerequisites: anypower, [2]dome

data.title: build speed ideas
data.body:
1) It would be great if you can define the  build speed for very building individually.
For example  you can build a Barracks and a Fast Barracks both produces units but if you have the Fat Barracks the faster Build-Speed is chosen If the Fast Barracks is destroyed -> you build with the normal build speed

2) Like in original C&C TD you can build faster the more "Barracks" you have. 
- Also the LoadTime from the SupportPowers

data.title: Range 50 for weapons to low
data.body: Why the range of weapons is limited to 50? For example a submarine with nuke-missiles should shoot beyond 50 fields.
